a
prefix 1. prefix ā shortened before a double consonant. 2. a negative prefixed to nouns, adjectives; and participles. 3. the augment prefixed to some roots in the Past and Conditional Tenses; e.g. akāsi.
ariyasacca
neuter an established fact; noble truth.
aṃsa
masculine & neuter 1. a part; a side; 2. shoulder.
aṃsakūṭa
neuter shoulder.
aṃsabandhana
neuter shoulder strap.
aṃsu
masculine ray of light; a fibre.
aṃsuka
neuter cloth.
aṃsumālī
masculine the sun.
akaṅkhamāna
pr.p. of ākaṅkhati wishing; desiring.
akaṭa
adjective 1. not done; not made; 2. not artificial.
akaḍḍhati
ā + kaḍḍh + a pulls; drags.
akaḍḍhi
aor. of akaḍḍhati pulled; dragged.
akata
adjective 1. not done; not made; 2. not artificial.
akataññu
adjective ungrateful.
akatattā
indeclinable because one has not done.
akanta
adjective unpleasant.
akampiya
adjective immovable; stable; firm.
akaraṇa
neuter non-action.
akaraṇīya
pt.p. of that should not be done; (nt.), improper action.
akari
aor. did.
akaronta
pr.p. not doing or performing.
akā
aor. did.
akāca
adjective flowless.
akāmaka
adjective unwilling.
akāla
masculine inappropriate. (adj.), out of reason.
akāsi
aor. of karoti. did, made, or performed.
akiñcana
adjective having nothing.
akiṭila
adjective straight; honest; not crooked.
akiranta
pr.p. of pouring.
akiriya
neuter non-action.
akiriyavāda
masculine the theory that therre is no after-death of action.
akilāsu
adjective untiring; active.
akuṭila
adjective straight; honest; not crooked.
akutobhaya
adjective safe from every quarter.
akuppa
adjective steadfast; unshakable.
akusala
neuter demerit; sin; bad action. (adj.), unskilful.
akovida
adjective not clever.
akka
masculine 1. the sun; 2. swallow-word plant.
akkanta
pp. of akkamati 1. stepped upon; trodden; 2. subdued.
akkandati
ā + kand + a wails, cries.
akkandana
neuter wailing.
akkandi
aor. of akkandati wailed, cried.
akkamati
ā + kam + a steps or treads upon; subjugates.
akkamana
neuter 1. stepping or treading upon; 2. subjugation.
akkami
aor. of akkamati stepped; subjugated.
akkamma
abs. having trodden upon.
akkuṭṭha
pp. of akkosati abused; reviled; scolded.
akkocchi
aor. of akkosati abused; reviled; scolded.
akkosa
masculine insult; abuse; reproach.
akkosaka
masculine one who insults.
akkosati
ā + kus + a abuses; reviles; scolds.
akkosana
neuter abuse.
akkosi
aor. of akkosati abused; reviled; scolded.
akkositvā
abs. of akkosati having abused; having reviled; having scolded.
akkha
neuter sense organ. (m.), axle; dice; beleric myrobalan; a measurement equal to 20 grains. (akkha in the cpds. such as visālakkha, sahasakkha is from the stem akkhi = eye).
akkhaka
neuter collar-bone.
akkhaṇa
masculine inappropriate time.
akkhaṇavedhī
masculine an archer who shoots as quickly as lightning or shoots only to graze the object.
akkhaṇā
feminine a lightning.
akkhata
adjective unhurt; not wounded; faultless.
akkhadassa
masculine a judge; an umpire.
akkhadhutta
adjective addicted to gambling. (m.), gambler.
akkhaya
adjective changeless; eternal; decayless. (nt.), the eternal peace.
akkhara
neuter a letter; a syllable.
akkharaphalaka
masculine a board or slate to write on.
akkharasamaya
masculine the science of writing and reading.
akkhāta
pp. of akkhāti announced; told; declared.
akkhāti
ā + khā + a announces; tells; declares.
akkhātar
masculine one who relates or preaches.
akkhāyī
masculine one who relates or preaches.
akkhāsi
aor. of akkhāti announced; told; declared.
akkhi
neuter eye.
akkhikūpa
masculine socket of the eye.
akkhitārā
feminine pupil of the eye.
akkhitta
adjective not despised or thrown away.
akkhidala
neuter eyelid.
akkhobha
adjective imperturbable.
akkhobhinī
feminine 1. a number consisting of 42 ciphers; 2. an army of 109, 350 soldiers, 65, 610 horses, 21870 elephants and 21, 870 war chariots.
akkhohinī
feminine a high numeral with 43 cyphers.
akhetta
neuter unsuitable place.
agati
feminine 1. wrong course; 2. prejudice.
agada
neuter medicine, drug.
agaru
adjective not heavy; not troublesome. (m.), aloe wood.
agalu
masculine aloe wood.
agādha
adjective 1. very deep; 2. supportless.
agāra
neuter house; a dwelling place.
agāraka
neuter a small house; a cottage.
agārika
adjective & masculine lay man; householder.
agāriya
adjective & masculine lay man; householder.
agga
adjective the highest; the top-most. (m.), the end; the top.
aggañña
adjective known as the highest or foremost.
aggatā
feminine pre-eminence.
aggatta
neuter pre-eminence.
aggaphala
neuter 1. the first harvest of a cultivation; 2. supreme fruit of arahantship.
aggamagga
masculine the highest path of salvation.
aggamahesī
feminine the queen-consort.
aggala
neuter bolt; latch.
aggavādī
masculine the greastest teacher.
aggi
masculine fire.
aggikkhandha
masculine a great mass of fire.
aggiparicaraṇa
neuter fire-worship.
aggisālā
feminine a heated room.
aggisikhā
feminine flame.
aggihutta
neuter fire-sacrifice.
aggha
masculine price; value. (nt.), obligation made to a guest.
agghaka
adjective (in cpds:), having the value of.
agghakāraka
masculine valuator; appraiser.
agghati
aggh + a is worth; deserves.
agghanaka
adjective (in cpds:), having the value of.
agghāpana
neuter setting a price; valuation.
agghāpanaka

agghāpaniya

agghi
aor. of agghati deserved.
agghika
neuter a post decorated with festoons.
agghiya
neuter a post decorated with festoons; an abligation made to a guest.
agghīyati
v. is esteemed.
agha
neuter 1. the sky; 2. grief; pain; 3. sin; misfortune.

aṅgada
adjective & neuter bracelet for arm.
aṅganā
feminine woman.
aṅgapaccaṅga

aṅgarakapalla
masculine pan for holding cinders.

feminine a pit full of cinders.

masculine & neuter charcoal; embers.

masculine pan for holding cinders.

masculine the resplendent one; the Buddha.

adjective steadfast.
acala

acava

acira

aciraṃ

accagā

accantaṃ

ajina
masculine a cheetah, i.e. a long limbed beast of cat family with tawny fur and black spots. The Sinhalese term “andum diviyā” shows that it is a kind of leopard. nt. its hide.

= one who rejoices; enjoying.

āvajjati
ā + vajj + a 1. reflects upon; 2. upsets (a vessel).
āvajji
aor. of āvajjati 1. reflected upon; 2. upset (a vessel).
āvajjita
pp. of āvajjeti 1. considered; 2. turned over.
āvajjeti
ā + vajj + e 1. muses; 2. observes; 3. turns over.
āvajjesi
aor. of āvajjeti 1. mused; 2. observed; 3. turned over.
āvaṭa
pp. of āvarati covered; veiled; prohibited.
āvaṭṭa
masculine 1. circumference; 2. a whirlpool; 3. twisting.
āvaṭṭati
ā + vaṭṭ + a turns forward and backward; rotates.
āvaṭṭana
neuter 1. revolving; 2. temptation; 3. possession by some spirit.
āvaṭṭanī
adjective enticing.
āvaṭṭi
aor. of āvaṭṭati turned forward and backward; rotated.
āvaṭṭeti
ā + vaṭṭ + e 1. turns round; 2. entices; converts.
āvatta
pp. of āvattati fallen back to. (nt.) winding; turn; bent.
āvattaka
adjective coming back; one who returns.
āvattati
ā + vat + a goes back; turns round.
āvattana
neuter turning; return.
āvatti
aor. of āvattati went back; turned round.
āvattita
pp. of āvattati gone back; turned round.
āvattiya
adjective turnable; returnable.
āvattī
adjective coming back; one who returns.
āvatteti
= āvaṭṭeti, 1. turns round; 2. entices; converts.
āvatthika
adjective befitting; original.
āvapasika
adjective resident.
āvaraṇa
neuter shutting off; hindrance; a bar; a screen.
āvaraṇīya
adjective apt to obstruct.
āvarati
ā + var + a shuts out from; obstructs.
āvari
aor. of āvarati shut out from; obstructed.
āvarita
pp. of āvarati shut out from; obstructed.
āvariya
abs. of āvarati having obstructed.
āvalī
feminine a row; a string.
āvasati
ā + vas + a lives; resides; inhabits.
āvasatha
masculine abode; dwelling; rest-house.
āvasathāgāra
neuter resthouse.
āvasi
aor. of āvasati lived; resided; inhabited.
āvaha
adjective (in cpds.), bringing; bearing; conducive.
āvahati
ā + vah + a brings; causes; conduces.
āvahana
neuter (in cpds.), bringing; bearing; conducive.
āvahanaka
adjective (in cpds.), bringing; bearing; conducive.
āvahi
aor. of āvahati brought; caused; conduced.
āvāṭa
masculine a pit.
āvāpa
masculine potter's furnace; an oven.
āvāsa
masculine home; dwelling place.
āvāsika

āvāha

āvāhana

āvi
indeclinable openly; before one's eyes.
āvijjhati
ā + vij + ya 1. encircles; goes round; whirls round; 2. pierces through.
āvijjhana
neuter going to whirling round.
āvijjhi
aor. of āvijjhati 1. encircled; went round; whirled round; 2. pierced through.
āviñjati
ā + vij + ṃ-a 1. pulls as in milking; 2. churns; agitates.
āviñjanaka
adjective 1. swinging round; 2. hanging loose; 3. used for pulling.
āviñjanakanaṭṭhāna
neuter place outside the door where the rope is hanging with which the latch inside is to be raised.
āviñjanakarajju
feminine 1. the rope to raise a latch; 2. whirling rope used in churning milk.
āviñji
aor. of āviñjati 1. pulled as in milking; 2. churned; agitated.
āviṭṭha
pp. of āvisati entered; approached; was possessed by a spirit.
āviddha
pp. of āvijjhati 1. encircled; went round; whirled round; 2. pierced through.
āvila
adjective 1. stirred up; agitated; 2. dirty.
āvilatta
neuter state of being agitated or dirty.
āvisati
ā + vis + a 1. enters; approaches; 2. is possessed by a spirit.
āvisi
aor. of āvisati entered; approached; 2. was possessed by a spirit.

āvuṇi

āvuttha

āvuso
indeclinable (Vocative), friend; brother. (A form of polite address among monks).

itara
adjective the other.
itarītara
adjective whatsoever; any.
iti
indeclinable thus. (used to point out something just mentioned or about to be mentioned, and to show that a sentence is finished). Very often its former i is elided and ti only is remaining.
itikira
indeclinable thus I have heard.
itivuttaka
neuter a treatise of Suttas beginning with the phrase ‘thus it is said'.
itihāsa
masculine history; tradition.
ito
indeclinable from here; from now; hence.
itopaṭṭhāya
indeclinable hence-forth.
ittara

ittarakāla
masculine a short period.
itthaṃ
adverb thus; in this way.

itthaṃbhūta

itthatta

orūḷha
pp. of oruhati descended; climbed down.
orena
adverb under; within; below; on this side.
orodha
masculine 1. harem; seraglio; 2. a harem-lady.
oropana
neuter taking down; lowering; laying down.
oropayamana
pr.p. of oropeti taking or lower down; laying aside.
oropita
pp. of oropeti taken or lower down; laid aside.
oropiya
abs. of oropeti having taken or lower down; having laid aside.
oropeti

olaggeti

olaggesi

olamba
adjective hanging down. (nt.) a support; a plummet.
olambaka

from interrogative pron. kiṃ who; what; which.

indeclinable an indefinite interrogative particle expressing doubt. (Often it is followed by some other particle such as nu, nukho).

kiṃ
rel. or inter. pron. what? (m.) ko = who? (f.) kā = which woman? (nt.) kiṃ = what thing?
kiṃ kāraṇā
why?

jhatvā
= jhāpetvā.

masculine a fish.

paṭinissajji
aor. of paṭinissajjati gave up; renounced; forsook.
paṭinissajjitvā
abs. of paṭinissajjati having given up; having renounced; having forsaken.
paṭinissajjiya
abs. of paṭinissajjati having given up; having renounced; having forsaken.
paṭinissaṭṭha
pp. of paṭinissajjati given up; renounced; forsaken.
paṭinīta
pp. of paṭineti led back to.
paṭineti

paṭinetvā
abs. of paṭineti having led back to.
paṭinesi
aor. of paṭineti led back to.
paṭipakkha
adjective opposed; opposite. (m.) an enemy; opponent.
paṭipakkhika
inimical; of an opponent party.
paṭipajjati
paṭi + pad + ya enters upon a path or course; goes along; follows a method.
paṭipajjana
neuter procedure; practice; observance

paṭipajji

paṭipajjitvā
abs. of paṭipajjati having entered upon a path or course; having gone along; having followed a method.
paṭipaṇṇa
neuter a letter in reply.

paṭipatha

paṭipadā
feminine line of conduct; mode of progress.
paṭipanna

paṇḍaka
masculine an eunuch.
paṇḍara
adjective white.
paṇḍicca
neuter wisdom; erudition.
paṇḍita
adjective wise. (m.) a wise man.
paṇḍitaka
masculine a pedant.
paṇḍu
adjective pale-yellow; yellowish.
paṇḍukambala
neuter an orange-colored blanket; name of the Sakka's throne.
paṇḍupalāsa
masculine a withered leaf; one who is ready to leave household life.
paṇḍuroga
masculine jaundice.
paṇḍurogī
masculine one who suffers from jaundice.
paṇṇa
neuter a leaf; a leaf for writing upon; a letter.
paṇṇaka
neuter a leaf; a leaf for writing upon; a letter.
paṇṇakuṭi
feminine a hut of leaves.
paṇṇacchatta
neuter a sunshade made of leaves.
paṇṇatti
feminine designation; name; concept; idea; a regulation.

adjective fifteen.

masculine a mattress of leaves.
paṇṇasālā
feminine a hermitage.
paṇṇākāra
masculine a present.
paṇṇāsā
feminine fifty.
paṇṇika

paṇya
masculine a trader.
paṇhi
masculine the heel.
patati
pat + a falls down; alights on.
patana
neuter falling.

patanta
pr.p. of patati falling down; alighting on.
patākā

patāpa

pati
prefix prefix having the meanings; against; opposite, towards, in opposition to.
patikula
neuter husband's family.

patiṭṭhahati

feminine help; support; resting place.

pattakkhandha

masculine a foot-soldier; an infantry. (f.) arrival; attainment; merit; profit; share.
pattika

pattidāna
neuter transference of merit or share.
pattuṃ

pattuṇṇa

paridhāvitvā
abs. of paridhāvati having run about.
paridhota
pp. of paridhovati washed all round; cleansed.
paridhovati
pari + dho + a washes all round; cleanses.
paridhovi
aor. of paridhovati washed all round; cleansed.
parināyaka
masculine a guide; leader; adviser.
parināyakaratana
neuter the chief of the army of a universal monarch.
parināyikā
feminine a woman leader; insight.
pariniṭṭhāna
neuter the end; accomplishment.
pariniṭṭhāpita
pp. of pariniṭṭhāpeti brought to an end; accomplished.
pariniṭṭhāpeti
pari + ni + ṭhā + āpe brings to an end; accomplishes.
pariniṭṭhāpetvā
abs. of pariniṭṭhāpeti having brought to an end; having accomplished.
pariniṭṭhāpesi
aor. of pariniṭṭhāpeti brought to an end; accomplished.
parinibbāti
pari + ni + vā + a dies without being reborn.
parinibbāna
neuter final release from transmigration; death after the last life-span of an arahant.
parinibbāpana
neuter complete extinction or cooling.
parinibbāyi
aor. of parinibbāti died without being reborn.
parinibbāyitvā
abs. of parinibbāti having died without being reborn.
parinibbāyī
adjective one who has attained the final release.
parinibbuta
pp. of parinibbāti died without being reborn.
paripakka
pp. of paripaccati quite ripe; well-matured.
paripaṭati
= paripatati., falls down; goes to ruin.

paripati

paripatita
pp. of paripatati fallen down; gone to ruin.

masculine danger; obstacle.
paripanthika

paripāka

paripācana

paripācita

paripācesi

paripātesi

pp. of sanneti mixed; kneaded.

sannipatitvā

sannipātika

hiṃs + a hurts; injures; teases.
hiṃsana
neuter teasing; injury; hurting.
hiṃsanā
feminine teasing; injury; hurting.
hiṃsanta
pr.p. of hiṃsati hurting; injuring.
hiṃsamāna
pr.p. of hiṃsati hurting; injuring.
hiṃsā
feminine teasing; injury; hurting.
hiṃsāpita
pp. of hiṃsāpeti caused to hurt or injure.
hiṃsāpeti
caus. of hiṃsati causes to hurt or injure.
hiṃsāpetvā
abs. of hiṃsāpeti having caused to hurt or injure.
hiṃsāpesi
aor. of hiṃsāpeti caused to hurt or injure.
hiṃsi
aor. of hiṃsati hurt; injured; teased.
hiṃsita
pp. of hiṃsati hurt; injured; teased.
hiṃsitvā
abs. of hiṃsati having hurt; having injured; having teased.
hikkā
feminine hiccup.
hiṅgu
neuter the exudation of asafoetida plant.
hiṅgulaka
neuter vermilion.
hiṅguli
feminine vermilion.
hita
neuter benefit; blessing; good; welfare. (adj.), useful; beneficial. (m.), a friend.
hitakara
adjective doing what is beneficial.
hitāvaha
(hitā + avaha), adj. beneficial.
hitesī
masculine benefactor; desiring another's welfare.
hintāla
masculine the marshy date palm.
hima
neuter snow; ice.
himavant
adjective having snow or ice; the Himalaya mountains.
hiyyo
adverb yesterday.
hirañña
neuter unwrought gold.
hiraññasuvaṇṇa
neuter gold & money.
hiri
feminine shyness; sense of shame.
hirikopīna
neuter that which arouses shyness, i.e. the male or female organ.
hirimant
adjective modest; bashful.
hirīyati
deno. from hiri blushes; is shy or ashamed.
hirīyanā
feminine shyness; sense of shame.
hirottappa
neuter shame and fear for sin.
hīna
pp. of hāyati diminished; dwindled; wasted away. (adj.), low; inferior; base; despicable.
hīnajacca
adjective having a low birth.
hīnaviriya
adjective lacking in energy.
hīnādhimuttika
(hīna + adhimuttika) adj. having low inclinations.
hīyati
pass. of hāyati is decreased or dwindled; decays; is left or given up.
hīyamāna
pr.p. of hīyati decaying.
hīyi
aor. of hīyati was decayed.
hīyo
adverb yesterday.
hīra
neuter a splinter; a stripe.
hīraka
neuter a splinter; a stripe.
hīlana
neuter disdain; contempt.
hīlanā
feminine disdain; contempt.
hīḷayamāna
pr.p. of hīḷeti scorning; disdaining.
hīḷita
pp. of hīḷeti scorned; disdained; despised.
hīḷeti
hīḷ + e scornes; disdains; despises.
hīḷetvā
abs. of hīḷeti having scorned; having disdained; having despised.
hīḷesi
aor. of hīḷeti scorned; disdained; despised.
huṅkāra
masculine the sound “hum.”
huta
neuter the thing sacrificed; an oblation.
hutāsna
neuter fire.
hutta
neuter sacrifice.
hutvā
abs. of hoti having been.
huraṃ
adjective in the other world; in another existence.
hurāhuraṃ
indeclinable from one place to another.
huveyya
v. it may be.
he
a vocative particle hey; eh; here; my dear.
heṭṭābhāga
masculine the lower part.
heṭṭhato
adverb from below.
heṭṭhā
adverb below; down; underneath.
heṭṭhābhāga
masculine the lower portion.
heṭṭhāmañce
adverb under the bed.
heṭṭhima
adjective lower.
heṭhaka
adjective one who harasses or troubles.
heṭhanā
feminine harassing.
heṭhayamāna
pr.p. of heṭheti harassing; worrying.
heṭhita
pp. of heṭheti harassed; worried; injured.
heṭheti

heṭhetvā
abs. of heṭheti having harassed.
heṭhenta
pr.p. of heṭheti harassing; worrying.
heṭhesi
aor. of heṭheti harassed; worried; injured.
hetu
masculine cause; reason; condition.
hetuka
adjective connected with a cause.
hetuppabhava
adjective arising from a cause.
hetuvāda
masculine the theory of cause.
hetuso
indeclinable according to the causes.
hema
neuter gold.
hemajāla
neuter a golden netting.
hemanta
masculine the winter.
hemantika
adjective belonging to the winter; icy cold.
hemavaṇṇa
adjective golden coloured.
hemavataka
adjective living in the Himalaya.
heraññika
masculine a goldsmith; a money-changer.
hesā
feminine the neighing of a horse.
hesārava
masculine the neighing of a horse.
hehiti
v. it will be.
hotabba
pt.p. of hoti should be existed.
hoti
hū + a to be; exists.
hotuṃ
inf. of hoti to exist.
honta
pr.p. of hoti existing.
homa
neuter oblation.
horā
feminine hour.
horāpāṭhaka
masculine an astrologer.
horāyanta
neuter any device showing the time; a clock.
horālocana
neuter a watch; a clock.
